question.title: How to get astyle to wrap methods in Java-code?
question.body:
I have max-code-length=80 set in my ~/.astylerc, along with indent=tab=4 but running astyle on the Java-code leaves some rather long method-declarations unwrapped.

How would I get the

    private MyConstructor(String one, String two, String three, String four, String five)
    {

modified into

    private MyConstructor(String one, String two, String three,
        String four, String five)
    {

Other long lines do get wrapped as expected, but not these... The full .astylrc is below.

style=bsd
attach-classes
attach-namespaces
attach-extern-c
attach-inlines
attach-closing-while
indent=tab=4
unpad-paren
pad-oper
pad-header
indent-after-parens
indent-continuation=4

align-pointer=name
max-code-length=80
break-after-logical

squeeze-lines=1
delete-empty-lines
remove-braces

question_comments.body: Constructors are not methods. I normally just use the formatter maven plugin and call it "good enough".
